channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: London's Biggest Perl team
item.description: Large, dynamic Perl team in Canary Wharf looking for mid-level and senior developers. Run by a Perl-loving CTO in beautiful offices with a great view over Canary Wharf, the company manages one legacy Perl codebase and a whole bunch of very new, very shiny, and very modern codebases

item.title: Problem-solvers for very strong Perl Fintech/Banking team in London
item.description: Very strong Perl team in central London with a reputation for technical excellence and doing things their own way. Expect to be challenged by very bright co-workers who are determined to move fast and break things.

item.title: Fancy a few days a week in beautiful Irvine, CA? Mountain and harbour views from the office
item.description: We are looking for a fulltime Perl developer who can join us onsite at our beautiful offices a few days a week in Irvine, and work from home the rest of the time (or fulltime in Irvine).

item.title: The fREW Schmidt Interview Experience
item.description: Frew shares his thoughts on interviewing developers, based on his experience interviewing candidates for ZipRecruiter. As he says, ultimately interviewing is really hard.

item.title: What it feels like to be an open-source maintainer
item.description: Nolan shares what it can feel like, maintaining open source projects that are popular. TL;DR: "I've already told my partner that, if and when we decide to start having kids, I will probably quit open source for good".

item.title: Makoto Nozaki Appointed Secretary
item.description: Makoto Nozaki, who is the chair of the Perl Foundation grants committee, has joined TPF board as secretary.

item.title: Camel Doctor version 0.1.0
item.description: Dimitar announces the first release of Camel Doctor, a web-based interface to the Perl debugger.

item.title: Solving twenty-four puzzles
item.description: Back in July of last year, Mark blogged about a type of puzzle that his kids were having fun with. Here he talks through the design of his solution, and links to his Perl code.

item.title: Telegram Keyboard Button Encoding
item.description: Telegram is a messaging service, one of the best-known features of which is end-to-end encryption of your messages. In the client you can define custom buttons, and Flavio has used Perl to abuse this feature.

item.title: A Unicode Search Tool
item.description: Moritz takes us through the creation of a command-line tool for looking up Unicode characters, inspired by the uni command for Perl 5.

item.title: The IOs Are A-Changin'
item.description: The regular weekly roundup of Perl 6 news: some bugs have been fixed, some things have been made faster, and some other stuff.

item.title: Modules - Behind the scenes
item.description: Gabor has a look at some of the core modules that are shipped with Perl itself.

item.title: Tools to package Perl scripts, modules, and applications
item.description: Gabor goes through some of the tools you can use to package your code, for CPAN, or not.

item.title: For your 'Ä°'s and 'Ä±'s only
item.description: Sinan has been grubbing around in Perl's internals, as part of his ongoing quest for something-or-other related to Unicode, Perl, and Windows.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: February 20th-26th
item.description: Sawyer's weekly update from the P5P mailing list, the headline of which is that Perl 5.25.10 is now available.

item.title: Make your CPAN module static installable
item.description: Kaji-san explains how you can make your CPAN distributions support static installation. This means a client doesn't have to run Makefile.PL or Build.PL, which makes the installation process much quicker.

item.title: A new release of DBD::mysql
item.description: Michiel announces a new developer release of DBD::mysql, with improved handling of UTF-8, and lots of other improvements. He's looking for more testing, and if that doesn't turn up anything bad, then a non-developer release will come this week.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #293 - Release of DBD::mysql coming
item.description:
There's a new release of DBD::mysql coming. If you use it, Michiel would appreciate the developer release being tested.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
